New Records: Myles Turner recorded his seventh career 30+ point and 10+ rebound game
Tyrese Haliburton has extended his double-double streak to four games
Myles Turner recorded his first double-double of the season
Luka Doncic recorded his first game with 10+ assists on the season
Key Match Events: Andrew Nembhard drilled a three to start the game and a 15-2 run for the Pacers
Kyrie Irving drilled a three with 2:39 remaining in the half to give Dallas its first lead
Tyrese Haliburton extended Indiana’s advantage to 94-86 with a near thirty foot three
Bennedict Mathurin delivered a three with Doncic all up in his face with 2:12 left in the game to make it 129-120
Pre-Game Insights: Indiana Pacers lost Isaiah Jackson (torn achilles) and Aaron Nesmith (sprained left ankle) in their loss to the New Orleans Pelicans
Bennedict Mathurin was thrust into the starting lineup for the second consecutive game
Miscellaneous Highlights: Indiana is now 3-1 in Dallas underneath Rick Carlisle since returning in 2021
Indiana has won five of the last six meetings in Dallas
In all seven games this season for the Pacers, the team that has won the rebounding margin, has won the game
